results.content:
This course did a superb job of covering everything you need to start building Web Api's using Asp .Net and C#, which also includes Entity Framework Code First Approach, Azure deployment , Web Api hosting and of-course the caching of web api's . 

The lectures are in decent size chunks, and you are encouraged to code along with the instructor. 

To sum up I'd say this is an excellent course to take if you want to be a real back-end developer with Asp .Net.
results.content_html:
This course did a superb job of covering everything you need to start building Web Api's using Asp .Net and C#, which also includes Entity Framework Code First Approach, Azure deployment , Web Api hosting and of-course the caching of web api's .

The lectures are in decent size chunks, and you are encouraged to code along with the instructor.

To sum up I'd say this is an excellent course to take if you want to be a real back-end developer with Asp .Net.

En general el curso es bueno y llenó mis expectativas; sin embargo, en mi concepto hacen falta dos secciones:
1. Cómo hacer el deploy hacia un servidor IIS on premise

results.content:
The instructor does not go in depth about the topic. The course is very basic. There seems to be a large gap between items being explained. 
For instance, the author explains about authentication and authorization but does not explain the core concepts of it. He shows how to accomplish it using build in methods (only authentication, he skipped authorization) but does not explain the classes created and the how its used.

response.content: Hi Ashwin! All the concepts were explained very carefully and all the people all over the world enjoying this course. And you are the only one who just claimed that you did not like this course and that's because I've written clearly on the description of this page that knowledge of c# and asp .net is must for this course and you're the beginner and you don't have any past c# and asp .net knowledge and that's the reason you're facing difficulties in this course. I recommend you to go ahead and learn the basics of programming first.
response.content_html: Hi Ashwin! All the concepts were explained very carefully and all the people all over the world enjoying this course. And you are the only one who just claimed that you did not like this course and that's because I've written clearly on the description of this page that knowledge of c# and asp .net is must for this course and you're the beginner and you don't have any past c# and asp .net knowledge and that's the reason you're facing difficulties in this course. I recommend you to go ahead and learn the basics of programming first.

results.content_html:
The instructor does not go in depth about the topic. The course is very basic. There seems to be a large gap between items being explained.
For instance, the author explains about authentication and authorization but does not explain the core concepts of it. He shows how to accomplish it using build in methods (only authentication, he skipped authorization) but does not explain the classes created and the how its used.

results.content: This is a fantastic course!  I had never used Windows, Visual Studio or C#. I have a background in macOS, Java, JavaScript, and some ReST knowledge.  I was able to follow the instructor by coding along even with my limited experience on this platform.  He is very thorough in his explanations and I came away with a good grasp of the .NET Web API framework.  I also received a notification that this course is now available on macOS using Visual Studio.  I plan to take this course immediately. Highly recommend this course and its instructor.
results.content_html: This is a fantastic course! I had never used Windows, Visual Studio or C#. I have a background in macOS, Java, JavaScript, and some ReST knowledge. I was able to follow the instructor by coding along even with my limited experience on this platform. He is very thorough in his explanations and I came away with a good grasp of the .NET Web API framework. I also received a notification that this course is now available on macOS using Visual Studio. I plan to take this course immediately. Highly recommend this course and its instructor.

results.content:
The course gave me a superb overview of REST, its principles and the related technologies and their practical integration. 
It helped me to understand and structure the domain and to identify where to focus on. It is a really great launch into REST. I enjoyed this course because it contains all the things that one need to become a professional web api developer.

results.content: Great course! Now I understand how to write API's in .NET C#. I've been wanting to understand it for quite a while now. And now that I know, it's much simpler than I expected. The instructor goes in depth about each thing you can do with .NET C# in writing API's. Would recommend!
results.content_html: Great course! Now I understand how to write API's in .NET C#. I've been wanting to understand it for quite a while now. And now that I know, it's much simpler than I expected. The instructor goes in depth about each thing you can do with .NET C# in writing API's. Would recommend!

results.content: Great presentation. Very clear voice and easy to follow. However, the fact that MS changed the way to create a database in Azure since Asfend first did the presentation, and the fact that he mentions this five chapters LATER, instead of redoing the chapter, ended up costing me several hours to try to figure out (I didn't figure out the Firewall stuff on my own). Please consider redoing chapter 47 for future students!
results.content_html: Great presentation. Very clear voice and easy to follow. However, the fact that MS changed the way to create a database in Azure since Asfend first did the presentation, and the fact that he mentions this five chapters LATER, instead of redoing the chapter, ended up costing me several hours to try to figure out (I didn't figure out the Firewall stuff on my own). Please consider redoing chapter 47 for future students!

results.content: Personally i am not a big fan of Entity Framework as i always work a distributed database which will be used by multiple applications. And it would have been more appropriate, if the course covers more of Authentication with Client side calls. And deployment to IIS for an on Premises Windows servers. Deploying to Azure is good, but should have also covered Windows servers.
results.content_html: Personally i am not a big fan of Entity Framework as i always work a distributed database which will be used by multiple applications. And it would have been more appropriate, if the course covers more of Authentication with Client side calls. And deployment to IIS for an on Premises Windows servers. Deploying to Azure is good, but should have also covered Windows servers.
